title: Lots of logs about failing to extract history archive message

milestone.description:
Priorities **in priority order** for the 0.13 milestone:

**1. Finish items started in 0.12**
- Complete any outstanding issues related to pairing (for syncing) - Igor
- Implement the 'Admin' role (issue #10114) - Mykhailo
- Any remaining work to pay off tech. debt related to mutual contacts - Mishka
- When creating/editing token based permission, ability to search for and selecting Collectables from OpenSea - MichaelC

**2. Channel token permissions**
- Create, edit and delete channel token permissions in the permissions admin screens
- This includes the "no tokens required to view this channel" permission
- All user facing channel token permissions functionality e.g. what happens when a user tries to access a token gated channel they don't have the required tokens to access, what happens when a user only has permissions to view a channel, etc...
- If a community is an open (not token gated at the community level) community, if a channel is token gated AND if **no** "no tokens required to view this channel" permission for that channel exists, then the channel should be automatically encrypted.  If token gating is removed from a channel, the channel should become unencrypted.

**3. DB perf improvements**
- https://www.notion.so/Database-related-performance-1dbaa7ea894c461d885e55676683be07
- Alex and Patryk to work on this, with help from Lukáš

**4. Update app to use new 'Share URL' formats**
- add functionality to status-go to generate the new 'Share URL' formats for sharing links to: User Profiles, Communities, Channel inside a Community (issue https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/10851)
- Update everywhere a user can share a URL from to use the new URL format (issue https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/10852)
- New/updated URL unroll designs for inside chat, including specific unrolls for the new User Profile, Community and Channel inside a Community URLs (issue https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/10585)
- Ability to share a URL that points to a specific channel in a community (issue #10160)
- Update all address inputs to accept a user pasting a 'share URL' into the input (in addition to being able to input the raw address).  This includes: Start new chat input, send contact request input in Settings, the import community key input, etc...
- Update Status Desktops URL handler so that if Status is installed on a computer, when a user clicks on a Status 'Share URL' the app is launched (if not already running) and after signing in the user is automatically taken to the entity the Share URL represented inside the app.  e.g. if a user clicks on a URL for a Status Community, the user should be taken to the home screen for that community inside the Status App

**5. Mint Assets functionality**
- Also includes some small improvements to the mint Collectables functionality
- Noelia, GravityBlast

**6. Profile showcase backend**


**--- For the Wallet team ---**
tldr; continue building out Ben's wallet designs

1. Complete any outstanding development related to the activity screens
2. All accounts overview screens
3. New settings screens
4. Implement 'imported key and account' syncing and transfer between devices

body:
# Bug Report

## Description

I have a test account with a couple communities where I am the owner. The history archive is active plus some permissions.

I get A LOT of those logs:

```
2023-05-03T13:39:51.270-0400	INFO	communities/manager.go:193	importing message archive, 1 left
2023-05-03T13:39:51.270-0400	INFO	communities/manager.go:193	extracting messages from history archive	{"archive id": "0xe069f871b66ffdd1414fcf7157c26824340b43850d0e1014ab2390ab930ff700"}
2023-05-03T13:39:51.270-0400	INFO	communities/manager.go:193	failed to unmarshal protocol message	{"error": "string field contains invalid UTF-8"}
2023-05-03T13:39:51.270-0400	INFO	communities/manager.go:193	failed to extract history archive messages	{"error": "string field contains invalid UTF-8"}
```

If needed, I can share my data dir.

## Steps to reproduce

Unsure. I have 4 different communities. Most have Archive active. Some have permissions.

#### Expected behavior

No logs or at least the log only once

#### Actual behavior

I'm getting spammed by these logs.

### Additional Information

- Status desktop version: master `f65608811219860425be90c91efafea29450bdee`
- Operating System: Ubuntu 20

@jrainville your Status dir plus passphrase would be of great help.
What's unexpected is that, you mentioned the account is owner of a few communities, however, based on the logs it tries to import archives (it's not something an owner of a community does, unless you're part of a community as non-owner)

@0x-r4bbit here is the data dir https://drive.google.com/file/d/1LK50SdQ-H0RlJe3wus07_9j-SjoQ5p-v/view?usp=sharing

Do note, there are a couple accounts in there, the one to test is called `verysad` (don't worry about the name lol)
The password is `1234567890`

I removed the archive data folder from there to make it lighter, so don't try to open the shared-account just in case.
@jrainville what exactly you want here? I can try to make just one log from last 3 and that's all.
got it

I was able to download the dtaa dir and use it. However, I can no longer reproduce the issue. 

I got this error 
```
2023-05-16T14:00:18.650-0400	INFO	communities/manager.go:191	failed to download history archive data	{"error": "torrent has timed out", "errorVerbose": "torrent has timed out
```

After reopening the app a second time though, I now get:
```
2023-05-16T14:04:09.357-0400	INFO	communities/manager.go:191	failed to extract history archive messages	{"error": "open /home/jonathan/dev/status-desktop/Status/data/archivedata/0x03812ae4b2353230eea264b493bd2050cf5a0f75b8f9fbc9bb37f2faec6b9ef6d5/index: no such file or directory"}
2023-05-16T14:04:09.457-0400	INFO	communities/manager.go:191	importing message archive, 1 left
2023-05-16T14:04:09.457-0400	INFO	communities/manager.go:191	failed to extract history archive messages	{"error": "open /home/jonathan/dev/status-desktop/Status/data/archivedata/0x03812ae4b2353230eea264b493bd2050cf5a0f75b8f9fbc9bb37f2faec6b9ef6d5/index: no such file or directory"}
2023-05-16T14:04:09.556-0400	INFO	communities/manager.go:191	importing message archive, 1 left
2023-05-16T14:04:09.556-0400	INFO	communities/manager.go:191	failed to extract history archive messages	{"error": "open /home/jonathan/dev/status-desktop/Status/data/archivedata/0x03812ae4b2353230eea264b493bd2050cf5a0f75b8f9fbc9bb37f2faec6b9ef6d5/index: no such file or directory"}
```
repeated over and over.

Hopefully it's related to the previous bug and you can reproduce. I'll try to create a new more compressed dir.

@jrainville as I remember, when I help @0x-r4bbit to test it, first log is okay. But second one is something strange... looks like the app have a links to files which bot exists. Do you have this files on your machine?

Ah you're right, I think it's files I deleted when I created the archive for the first time (to reduce its size). It makes sense that it doesn't find it.

The reason why I don't see the original error message probably makes sense too, if I deleted the original archive files.
I'll see if I still have the original data with the archive data.

> I'll see if I still have the original data with the archive data.

Sadly I don't :cry: 

Well, you can still fix the issue of the infinite logs about missing file. It's annoying.

I compressed again in tar.xz and it's not smaller sadly. I think it's because it includes the archive data.

here it is https://drive.google.com/file/d/1feAvTOBNy6lL1lQKH_0VdNwSkc8iddNG/view?usp=sharing

```
2023-05-16T14:04:09.357-0400	INFO	communities/manager.go:191	failed to extract history archive messages	{"error": "open /home/jonathan/dev/status-desktop/Status/data/archivedata/0x03812ae4b2353230eea264b493bd2050cf5a0f75b8f9fbc9bb37f2faec6b9ef6d5/index: no such file or directory"}
2023-05-16T14:04:09.457-0400	INFO	communities/manager.go:191	importing message archive, 1 left
2023-05-16T14:04:09.457-0400	INFO	communities/manager.go:191	failed to extract history archive messages	{"error": "open /home/jonathan/dev/status-desktop/Status/data/archivedata/0x03812ae4b2353230eea264b493bd2050cf5a0f75b8f9fbc9bb37f2faec6b9ef6d5/index: no such file or directory"}
2023-05-16T14:04:09.556-0400	INFO	communities/manager.go:191	importing message archive, 1 left
2023-05-16T14:04:09.556-0400	INFO	communities/manager.go:191	failed to extract history archive messages	{"error": "open /home/jonathan/dev/status-desktop/Status/data/archivedata/0x03812ae4b2353230eea264b493bd2050cf5a0f75b8f9fbc9bb37f2faec6b9ef6d5/index: no such file or directory"}
```

Okay so here the archive protocol knows there's one archive left to be imported. It has imported all other ones (at least it thinks it does).

As you both pointed out, it's however failing to extract archive messages because it can't find the archive index file.
The archive index file is a file that keeps track of all archives that exist in the torrent and tells the node, where to find specific archive data in the `data` file (which lives next right tot he `index` file.

If you've removed the `index` file from your archivedata folder, then it will never be able to figure out what archives to import.

> Ah you're right, I think it's files I deleted when I created the archive for the first time (to reduce its size). It makes sense that it doesn't find it.

This is something you should not do if you aren't sure the data hasn't been complete imported.
Also, removing the files in that archivedata folder also means that, when you seed the torrent yourself (which your node will try to do), the data to seed will not be available (torrent client might even error out, not sure)

@jrainville also to add, @borismelnik and I has already found out that your archive data was most likely corrupted in some way (in the original logs)

```
2023-05-03T13:39:51.270-0400	INFO	communities/manager.go:193	failed to unmarshal protocol message	{"error": "string field contains invalid UTF-8"}
2023-05-03T13:39:51.270-0400	INFO	communities/manager.go:193	failed to extract history archive messages	{"error": "string field contains invalid UTF-8"}
```

What happens here is that it located the bytes it needs to unmarshal into an archive protobuf, which includes the messages. However unmarshaling failed.

Unmarshaling into a certain struct fails when the data to unmarshal doesn't match the shape of the struct.
In our case, there are two places where this can happen:

1. The archive data to be extracted is encrypted. So unmarshaling this into an archive protobuf will fail as the encrypted data doesn't have the correct shape. We need to decrypt it first.
2. When unmarshaling fails the first time, we assume it's due to encryption, so we'll first decrypt the extracted bytes, **then** try unmarshaling again (which should then work). If it still fails (which it does in your case), then the data is broken.

Any chances you've somehow cancelled the data download? I assume most likely some bytes where missing for the archive in question.

@jrainville new link is unavailable for me :( will try to download first one again.
As @0x-r4bbit says, maybe you close the app in the middle of downloading archive?
@jrainville at the end I download the `data` folder but can't open it (not by the app nor DB browser) and can open my db files. Are you sure that the password is correct?

> @jrainville at the end I download the data folder but can't open it (not by the app nor DB browser) and can open my db files. Are you sure that the password is correct?

@borismelnik I downloaded the data dir as well and was able to open the database. I think what happens with you is that you tried to open the wrong database file with your sqlite browser. Make sure to open  `0x3418ab316a2838e35d695916084c1f899225f766cd542fd7459639eb3718c318.db `

@jrainville is there a chance to get access to the archivedata provided by the owner that produced it?

I've looked into the database and `verysad` knows about two archives, out which one hasn't been imported yet:

```
sqlite> SELECT * FROM community_message_archive_hashes;
0x03812ae4b2353230eea264b493bd2050cf5a0f75b8f9fbc9bb37f2faec6b9ef6d5|0x1dd6f86d9e77f6fee6402a2465af992dcc99c8b03a92f0f48c4dee61302a7507|1
0x03812ae4b2353230eea264b493bd2050cf5a0f75b8f9fbc9bb37f2faec6b9ef6d5|0xe069f871b66ffdd1414fcf7157c26824340b43850d0e1014ab2390ab930ff700|FALSE
```

Which means, to figure out why your node couldn't unmarshal the archive, we need to have the archivedata of the archive with the hash `0xe069f871b66ffdd1414fcf7157c26824340b43850d0e1014ab2390ab930ff700` and compare the bytes with the archive provided by the owner.

As I read in the thread here, you've deleted the archive data entirely, so I assume this will not be recoverable.
Then, the only thing we can do at least, is check whether the owner's archivedata is not corrupted.
And sorry for accidentally closing the issue

@0x-r4bbit I'm sure im open the correct database file :D don't know why it doesn't work for me.
How to detect who is the owner?

> Any chances you've somehow cancelled the data download? I assume most likely some bytes where missing for the archive in question.

It's quite possible. Those are all test accounts so I close recklessly most of the time



> is there a chance to get access to the archivedata provided by the owner that produced it?

Yeah I still have the owner data intact. It was from another clone, so I didn't touch it.
I'll zip it and send it.

> new link is unavailable for me :( will try to download first one again.

@borismelnik I made the link available to anyone at Status. Make sure you use your Status account/email to access it

Here is the data dir for the owner node: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1XEt9Y9DGOzha3oNwy9bcKJksNSKx3Xct/view?usp=sharing

Account is named `wawiii` and the password is again `1234567890`

I don't think anyone can reproduce this issue and it seems like it was due to user error (me). Closing for now.

If we re-experience it, we can re-open
